intro: Schizocalyx cuspidatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically narrow and pointed. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of pink, red, or white, which bloom during the summer months. Schizocalyx cuspidatus thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and vibrant floral display.
